alert.note: Alert for Northern Campbell (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 22 at 8:35AM MDT until October 22 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT TO 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY ACROSS NORTHEAST WYOMING...THE BLACK HILLS...AND SOUTHWEST SOUTH DAKOTA... .Today will be warm and dry across much of the area as a warm front lifts slowly north across northeast Wyoming, the Black Hills, and southern South Dakota. Southwesterly winds will become quite gusty near and to the south of the boundary in the afternoon, with humidity values dropping into the teens. Combined with dry fuels, this will produce critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 314... The National Weather Service in Rapid City has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect until 7 PM MDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 314 Northern Campbell. * WINDS...South 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity will produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
